flawed_nl_solution:
A leap year is one day shorter than a regular year, so it is 365 - 1 = <<365-1=634>>634 days.
Brittany washes her hair every other day, so she will wash it 634 / 2 = <<634/2=317>>317 times in a leap year.
A bottle of shampoo lasts her 14 / 1 / 4 = 14 * 4 = 3.5 washes.
If she buys 3 bottles, she will only have enough for 3.5 * 3 = <<3*3.5=10.5>>10.5 washes.
If she buys 4 bottles, she will have enough for 3.5 * 4 = <<4*3.5=14>>14 washes.
Since 10.5 < 317 and 14 > 317, Brittany needs 4 bottles of shampoo to get her through a leap year.
#### 4

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 364, not 634. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
